questions.question: After finishing your work on High Security Settings, what is a possible way to return to normal admin security levels?
answers: B. Log out and back in
E. Use System Administration > Normal Security module

comments.content: I agree with connal308876.
In Washington, you can select "Elevate Role" again, and deselect the checkbox.  Then click the Update button.
replies: Yes, but at least in my PDI it still shows up as elevated. The arrow doesn't disappear unless I log out or I start.end impersonation of a user. So the correct answer from this list can only be B.

comments.content: By default, you do not have elevated privilege roles upon login. You must manually elevate to the privilege of the role. An elevated privilege role lasts only for the duration of your user session. Session timeout or logout removes the role.
B: Login out and back in

questions.question: Which feature can be used to give users the choice to easily populate the most-used fields for a specific table?

comments.content: C: Template is correct

questions.question: What protects applications by restricting access to data in another application, in the same instance?

comments.content: Application scope protects app data.

comments.content: B is the correct answer
B is the right answer
B is correct answer
It is maintain items. You can check in PDI
B is correct
B. Maintain Items is correct

questions.question: What helps to define the structure of a catalog item form that is displayed to the customer?

comments.content: A correct

questions.question: Which displays the list of activities, or history, on a form?

comments.content:
Formatter is the correct answer.

The history menu only shows the history of your activities on the platform, not the form.
a is correct
Formatter

questions.question: Where should an administrator navigate to add the "Save" button in the form header?
answers: B. All > System Properties > UI Action Settings
C. All > System Properties > UI Properties

comments.content:
C is the correct answer.

You need to go to System Properties > UI Properties to enable the save, update and insert and stay option (true/false box) from the glide.ui.advance property.
C is correct, tried it in my PDI

questions.question: What are the options that can be set to determine when a Business Rule executes? (Choose four.)

comments.content: According to the vancouver SNAF e-book, the answer is ADEF
i cheked in my vancouver version the correct answers is ADEF
answer should be - ADEF
I checked in my PDI and the correct answer is ADEF
In business rule definition the "when" field contains before, after, async and display options (ADEF)

questions.question: Which access control rule applies to every field in the incident table?

comments.content: Wildcard applies to every field on a record, without a table.field rule - extract from the CSA Book.

questions.question: What is the purpose of an application scope?
answers: A. Scope determines which parts of an application are available for use by other applications In ServiceNow
B. Scope prevents applications from changing their own tables and business logic
C. Scope determines the functionality of core services in the platform
D. Scope determines all applications access each other's tables and business logic

comments.content: A is correct

questions.question: On a Catalog Task record, how would an administrator change the priority choice options?
answers: A. In the Context menu of the form, select Configure Options
B. Right-click the Priority Label > select Configure Lists
C. Right-click the Priority Label > select Configure Choices
D. Open the Data Dictionary > select Values

comments.content: Tested in PDI

questions.question: Which sequence of actions applies an update set to an instance?

comments.content: Basic steps per CSA book

questions.question:
A customer asks you to make the following updates to a form:

1. When Caller field is populated, automatically look up caller location and load it in the Location field.
2. Add notice at the top of the page when the record is submitted.

What type of script would you use to meet this requirement?

comments.content: CSA book uses these exact examples to explain what a Client Script is.
User Interface policies run on the Client side.

questions.question:
You are creating a catalog item for ordering a new desktop computer. The computers have these options:


Color: Black or Silver -

RAM: 32 MB or 64MB -

Keyboard: Standard or Ergonomic -

Monitor: 24 inch or 32 inch -

How would you add these options to the catalog item form?

comments.content: As per CSA book chapter on Catalog Items/Variables

questions.question: Which form element displays the list of activities, or history, on a task form?

comments.content: Activity Formatter shows all the activities in the task form

questions.question:
Your customer wants to update a notification so it is sent to the Caller's Manager.

Which action supports this requirement?
answers: A. On the 'Who will receive' tab on the Notification record add the Caller field, then dot walk to the Caller's Manager field to add it.
B. On the Notification record create a flow and include a notification in the flow for "All receivers".
C. On the 'Send to' tab on the Notification record, add the Caller field, then dot walk to the Callerâ€™s Manager field to add it.
D. On the 'Send to' tab on the Notification record, set "Who will receive" to Subscribable.

comments.content:
The correct answer is A. Verified.

https://www.servicenow.com/community/training-and-certifications/csa-exam-question-doubt-can-someone-helop-me-answering-this/m-p/3166078

 ff063b3 is a degenerate giving false answers.
There's no "Send to" tab anymore

In current ServiceNow patch answer A is correct.

My wife's boyfriend told me this as a fact

questions.question: Which action enables a user to view and specify date and time formats in their instance?
answers: A. Select the User menu > Preferences > Time Settings > Toggle display time zone
B. Ask the user to adjust the time zone on their personal computer
C. Use the system properties to correct the instance's time zone
D. Select the User menu > Preferences > Language & Region > Set date and time format and time zone
E. Create a UI Script to set the default timezone

comments.content:
The answer is C. 
All-> system properties -> System Configuration

Regarding D, there's no Language & Region. The only way using the preferences is to go to display and change the time there.

questions.question: Which storefront is a single location for accessing pre-built spokes, to quickly integrate with third party services to build and share content?

comments.content: NO such thing as a ServiceNow spoke store.
The answer is A. There is no such thing as a ServiceNow Spoke Store dfec26e is a degenerate providing wrong answers.
Servicenow does have a spoke store integrated do the answer is right
Isnt the answer A?
